meanings.definition: A mark or indication of quality or distinction
meanings.sent1: The gold seal on the certificate was an earmark of excellence.
meanings.sent2: The red ribbon on the package was an earmark of a special delivery.
meanings.sent3: The shiny sticker on the book was an earmark that made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The unique logo on the product was an earmark of the brand's identity.
meanings.sent5: The signature scent was an unmistakable earmark of the perfume.

meanings.definition: To set aside or designate for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: She decided to earmark some money for her vacation fund.
meanings.sent2: The committee voted to earmark funds for the new community center.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to earmark all the cookies for himself.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to earmark time for each student's presentation.
meanings.sent5: The chef would earmark the freshest ingredients for his special dish.

meanings.sent1: The bright red color was an earmark of the sports car.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness was an earmark of her personality.
meanings.sent3: The loud laugh became his earmark in the quiet office.
meanings.sent4: The tower's spire was an earmark of the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature style was an unmistakable earmark of her work.
